context: At its <a1_0><b10_0>press conference<b10_0/><a1_0/> at the <b5_0><b6_0>2007 Tokyo Game Show<b6_0/><b5_0/>, Sony announced <a0_0>DualShock 3<a0_0/> (trademarked <b9_0>DUALSHOCK 3<b9_0/>), a PlayStation 3 controller with the same function and design as Sixaxis, but with vibration capability included. Hands-on accounts describe the controller as being noticeably <a2_0><b11_0>heavier<b11_0/><a2_0/> than <b7_0>the standard Sixaxis controller<b7_0/> and capable of vibration forces comparable to DualShock 2. It was released in <a3_0><b12_0>Japan<b12_0/><a3_0/> on <b8_0>November 11, 2007<b8_0/>; in North America on April 5, 2008; in Australia on <a4_0><b13_0>April 24, 2008<b13_0/><a4_0/>; in New Zealand on May 9, 2008; in mainland Europe on July 2, 2008, and in the United Kingdom and Ireland on July 4, 2008.
